description: Enterprise techniques used by Bisonal, ATT&CK software S0268 v1.0
name: Bisonal (S0268)

techniques.comment: Bisonal can launch cmd.exe to execute commands on the system.
Bisonal variants reported on in 2014 and 2015 used a simple XOR cipher for C2.
Bisonal decodes strings in the malware using XOR and RC4.
Bisonal deletes its dropper and VBS scripts from the victim’s machine.
Bisonal's DLL file and non-malicious decoy file are encrypted with RC4.
Bisonal can obtain a list of running processes on the victim’s machine.
Bisonal adds itself to the Registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\CurrentVersion\Run\ for persistence.
Bisonal has the capability to download files to execute on the victim’s machine.

Bisonal uses rundll32.exe to execute as part of the Registry Run key it adds: HKEY_CURRENT_USER \Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\”vert” = “rundll32.exe c:\windows\temp\pvcu.dll , Qszdez”.
Bisonal's dropper creates VBS scripts on the victim’s machine.
Bisonal uses HTTP for C2 communications.
Some Bisonal samples encrypt C2 communications with RC4.
Bisonal has a command to gather system information from the victim’s machine.
Bisonal can execute ipconfig on the victim’s machine.
